sen.j: 大宮売神社（おおみやめじんじゃ）は、京都府京丹後市大宮町（旧中郡 (京都府)大宮町）にある神社である。
sen.e: Omiyame-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Omiya-cho, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture (formerly Omiya-cho, Naka County (Kyoto Prefecture)).
Omiyame-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Omiya-cho, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture (formerly Omiya-cho, Naka County (Kyoto Prefecture)).
Omiyame-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Omiya-cho, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture (formerly Omiya-cho, Naka County (Kyoto Prefecture)).

sen.j: 式内社（名神大社・二座）、丹後国二宮。
sen.e: It is listed in the Jinmyocho (register of shrines and deities) of the Engishiki (laws of the Engi era) as the Ninomiya (2nd ranked shrine) of Tango Province).
It is listed in the Jinmyocho (register of shrines and deities) of the Engishiki (laws of the Engi era) as the Ninomiya (2nd ranked shrine) of Tango Province).
It is listed in the Jinmyocho (register of shrines and deities) of the Engishiki (laws of the Engi era) as the Ninomiya (2nd ranked shrine) of Tango Province.

sen.j: 「大宮町」という旧町名の由来となっている。
sen.e: The shrine's name is derived from the "Omiya-cho" town in which it is located.
The shrine's name is derived from the "Omiya-cho" town in which it is located.
The shrine's name is derived from the 'Omiya-cho' town in which it is located.

sen.j: 祭神
sen.e: Enshrined Deities
Enshrined Deities
Enshrined deities

sen.j: 天照大神に仕え天皇を守護する八神殿の一柱であり、織物と酒造を司る大宮売神（おおみやめのかみ）、食物・穀物を司る女神である若宮売神（わかみやめのかみ、トヨウケビメ）の二神を祀る。
sen.e: Omiyame-jinja Shrine is of the Hasshinden (Eight Shrines) which enshrine deities that serve Amaterasu omikami and protect the emperor, and enshrines the god Omiyame no kami of textiles and rice wine production, the goddess Wakamiyame no kami (Toyouke bime) of food and grains.

Omiyame-jinja Shrine is of the Hasshinden (Eight Shrines) which enshrine deities that serve Amaterasu omikami and protect the emperor, and enshrines the god Omiyame no kami of textiles and rice wine production, the goddess Wakamiyame no kami (Toyouke bime) of food and grains.

Omiyame-jinja Shrine is of the Hasshinden (Eight Shrines) which enshrine deities that serve Amaterasu omikami and protect the emperor, and enshrines the god Omiyame no kami of textiles and rice wine production, the goddess Wakamiyame no kami (Toyouke bime) of food and grains.

sen.j: 大宮売神はアメノウズメであるともされる。
sen.e: Omiyame no kami is believed to be Amenouzume.
Omiyame no kami is believed to be Amenouzume.
Omiyame no kami is believed to be Amenouzume.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 草創の年代は不詳だが、「新抄格勅符抄」によると大同_(日本)元年（806年）に神封七戸を得たとされ、貞観_(日本)元年（859年）には従五位上の神階を賜わっている。
sen.e: The time of the shrine's founding is unknown but according to "Shinsho Kyakuchoku Fusho", the shrine was allotted seven households in the year 806 and was granted the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in the year 859.

The time of the shrine's founding is unknown but according to "Shinsho Kyakuchoku Fusho", the shrine was allotted seven households in the year 806 and was granted the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in the year 859.

The time of the shrine's founding is unknown but according to 'Shinsho Kyakuchoku Fusho,' the shrine was allotted seven households in the year 806 and was granted the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in the year 859.

sen.j: 大宮売神を祀る最も古い神社である。
sen.e: It is the oldest shrine to enshrine Omiyame no kami.
It is the oldest shrine to enshrine Omiyame no kami.
It is the oldest shrine to enshrine Omiyame no kami.

sen.j: 旧本殿は元禄8年（1695年）に建てられたとされ、丹後半島では珍しい隅木入春日造。
sen.e: The former main building is thought to have been constructed in 1695 and is built in the Sumikoiri Kasuga-zukuri style, which is rare on the Tango peninsula.
The former main building is thought to have been constructed in 1695 and is built in the Sumikoiri Kasuga-zukuri style, which is rare on the Tango peninsula.
The former main building is thought to have been constructed in 1695 and is built in the Sumikoiri Kasuga-zukuri style, which is rare on the Tango peninsula.

sen.j: 昭和2年（1927年）の北丹後地震で損壊し、現在は忠霊社としている。
sen.e: It was damaged in the northern Tango Province earthquake of 1927 and now serves as a Churei-sha Shrine (a shrine commemorating the war dead).
It was damaged in the northern Tango Province earthquake of 1927 and now serves as a Churei-sha Shrine (a shrine commemorating the war dead).
It was damaged in the northern Tango Province earthquake of 1927 and now serves as a Churei-sha Shrine (a shrine commemorating the war dead).

sen.j: 境外社・御旅所として当社から500mほどのところに石明神遺跡（古墳時代後期の横穴式石室跡）がある。
sen.e: The remains of Ishimyojin (a cave shrine dating from the latter part of the Kofun period), a sub-shrine and place where the sacred palanquin is lodged outside of the precinct, is located 500m from the shrine.

The remains of Ishimyojin (a cave shrine dating from the latter part of the Kofun period), a sub-shrine and place where the sacred palanquin is lodged outside of the precinct, is located 500m from the shrine.

The remains of Ishimyojin (a cave shrine dating from the latter part of the Kofun period), a sub-shrine and place where the sacred palanquin is lodged outside of the precinct, is located 500 m from the shrine.

sen.j: 境内には石燈籠2基があり、うち1基には「徳治2年3月7日_(旧暦)」と刻まれている。
sen.e: There are two stone lanterns within the precinct, of which one is engraved with 'the 7th day of the 3rd month of the 2 year of the Tokuji era' (1307).
There are two stone lanterns within the precinct, of which one is engraved with 'the 7th day of the 3rd month of the 2 year of the Tokuji era' (1307).
There are two stone lanterns within the precinct, of which one is engraved with 'the 7th day of the 3rd month of the 2 year of the Tokuji era (old lunar calendar)' (April 17, 1307).

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の石造美術品として貴重で国の重要文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: These are valuable as Kamakura period stone artifacts and have been nationally designated Important Cultural Properties.
These are valuable as Kamakura period stone artifacts and have been nationally designated Important Cultural Properties.
These are valuable as Kamakura period stone artifacts and have been nationally designated Important Cultural Properties.

sen.j: また境内そのものも祭祀遺跡であり、弥生時代後期から古墳時代前期にかけての土器や勾玉が出土しており府の指定文化財となっている（大宮売神社遺跡）。
sen.e: The remains of a ritual site, earthenware artifacts dating from the latter part of the Yaoyi period to the first part of the Kofun period and comma-shaped jewelry beads have also been excavated within the shrine precinct and are all cultural properties designated by Kyoto Prefecture (the remains of Omiyame-jinja Shrine).

The remains of a ritual site, earthenware artifacts dating from the latter part of the Yaoyi period to the first part of the Kofun period and comma-shaped jewelry beads have also been excavated within the shrine precinct and are all cultural properties designated by Kyoto Prefecture (the remains of Omiyame-jinja Shrine).

The remains of a ritual site, earthenware artifacts dating from the latter part of the Yayoi period to the first part of the Kofun period and comma-shaped jewelry beads have also been excavated within the shrine precinct and are all cultural properties designated by Kyoto Prefecture (the remains of Omiyame-jinja Shrine).

sen.j: 本殿の裏手は「禁足の杜」となっている。
sen.e: A "kinsoku no mori" (forbidden forest) is located behind the main building.
A "kinsoku no mori" (forbidden forest) is located behind the main building.
A 'kinsoku no mori' (forbidden forest) is located behind the main building.

sen.j: 近代の沿革
sen.e: Modern Timeline
Modern Timeline
Modern history

sen.j: 1872年：旧藩士の居宅を社務所として移築
sen.e: 1872: Former feudal warriors' residence relocated to serve as the shrine office.
1872: Former feudal warriors' residence relocated to serve as the shrine office.
1872: Former feudal warriors' residence relocated to serve as the shrine office.

sen.j: 1872年：郷社に指定される
sen.e: 1872: Designated a gosha (village shrine)
1872: Designated a gosha (village shrine)
1872: Designated a gosha (village shrine)

sen.j: 1924年4月5日：府社に昇格される
sen.e: 5th April 1924: Promoted to a fusha (prefectural shrine)
5th April 1924: Promoted to a fusha (prefectural shrine)
April 5, 1924: Promoted to a fusha (prefectural shrine)

sen.j: 1927年3月7日：丹後大震災により本殿の屋根などを損壊
sen.e: 7th March 1927: Roof of the main hall damaged in the Tango earthquake
7th March 1927: Roof of the main hall damaged in the Tango earthquake
March 7, 1927: Roof of the main hall damaged in the Tango earthquake

sen.j: 1930年4月11日：現本殿、絵馬舎等を落成
sen.e: 11th April 1930: The current main hall and ema hall (building for hanging votive tablets) completed
11th April 1930: The current main hall and ema hall (building for hanging votive tablets) completed
April 11, 1930: The current main hall and ema hall (building for hanging votive tablets) completed

sen.j: 1962年2月2日：石燈籠2基が国の重要文化財に指定される
sen.e: 2nd February 1962: The two stone lanterns nationally designated as Important Cultural Properties
2nd February 1962: The two stone lanterns nationally designated as Important Cultural Properties
February 2, 1962: The two stone lanterns nationally designated as Important Cultural Properties

sen.j: 1985年7月1日：旧本殿1棟が大宮町指定文化財に指定される
sen.e: 1st July 1985: The former main hall designated a cultural property of Omiya-cho
1st July 1985: The former main hall designated a cultural property of Omiya-cho
July 1, 1985: The former main hall designated a cultural property of Omiya-cho

sen.j: 1986年4月15日：境内全域が京都府指定文化財に指定される
sen.e: 15th April 1986: The entire shrine precinct designated a cultural property by Kyoto Prefecture
15th April 1986: The entire shrine precinct designated a cultural property by Kyoto Prefecture
April 15, 1986: The entire shrine precinct designated a cultural property by Kyoto Prefecture
